Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

links.slidetitle: 1. Balance sheet analysis provides a snapshot or photo a financial picture of the company on a given month.
links.displaytext: 1. Balance sheet analysis provides a snapshot or photo a financial picture of the company on a given month.

links.slidetitle: 2. The basic balance sheet equation is:  Assets = Liabilities + Equity
links.displaytext: 2. The basic balance sheet equation is:  Assets = Liabilities + Equity

links.slidetitle: 3. The balance sheet evaluation is an assessment of the value and liquidity of the company’s indebtedness.
links.displaytext: 3. The balance sheet evaluation is an assessment of the value and liquidity of the company’s indebtedness.

links.slidetitle: 4. In the balance sheet assets are listed in descending order of liquidity.
links.displaytext: 4. In the balance sheet assets are listed in descending order of liquidity.

links.slidetitle: 5. Non-current assets are expected to be converted into cash under the normal course of business within 12 months.
links.displaytext: 5. Non-current assets are expected to be converted into cash under the normal course of business within 12 months.

links.slidetitle: 6. The value of marketable securities is an important component in the lending decision especially if the investments will be considered as collateral for a loan.
links.displaytext: 6. The value of marketable securities is an important component in the lending decision especially if the investments will be considered as collateral for a loan.

links.slidetitle: 7. In manufacturers the inventory account is comprised of three (3) types of inventory: raw materials, finished goods and merchandise for sale.
links.displaytext: 7. In manufacturers the inventory account is comprised of three (3) types of inventory: raw materials, finished goods and merchandise for sale.

links.slidetitle: 8. There are two (2) major methods to value inventory: Last In First Out (LIFO) and First In Still Here (FISH).
links.displaytext: 8. There are two (2) major methods to value inventory: Last In First Out (LIFO) and First In Still Here (FISH).

links.slidetitle: 9. According to GAAP (General Accepted Accounting Principles) fixed assets will be registered on the balance sheet at book value.
links.displaytext: 9. According to GAAP (General Accepted Accounting Principles) fixed assets will be registered on the balance sheet at book value.
